item.title: Are We Having the Wrong AI Dreams?
item.description: (This opinion piece by JetBrainsâ€™ Team Lead in AI Development Experience reflects on key takeaways from NeurIPS 2025, a major AI research conference. item.title: The State of Rust 2025: Popularity, Trends, and Future

item.title: The Best AI Models for Coding: Accuracy, Integration, and Developer Fit
item.description: AI models and coding assistants have become essential tools for developers. Today, developers rely on large language models (LLMs) to accelerate coding, improve code quality, and reduce repetitive work across the entire development lifecycle. From intelligent code completion to refactoring, debugging, and documentation, AI-powered tools are now embedded directly into daily workflows. Drawing on insights [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2026/02/the-best-ai-models-for-coding-accuracy-integration-and-developer-fit/

item.title: dotInsights | February 2026
item.description: Did you know? C# allows digit separators (_) in numeric literals to make large numbers more readable, e.g., int num = 1_000_000; is valid and equals one million. Welcome to dotInsights by JetBrains! This newsletter is the home for recent .NET and software development related information. ðŸ”— Links Hereâ€™s the latest from the developer community. item.description: At JetBrains, we build tools that help teams work with complex systems in a more productive and enjoyable way. item.title: Extending Qodana: Adding Custom Code Inspections
item.description: Qodana is a static code analysis tool that brings code inspections and quick-fixes from JetBrains IDEs to the realm of continuous integration. It can be run in the cloud, executed from a Docker container, integrated into CI/CD pipelines, or invoked through a JetBrains IDE. Qodana already offers an impressive suite of inspections, but it is [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2026/02/extending-qodana-adding-custom-code-inspections/

item.description: February is a strange little month. Short, quiet, and typically uneventful.
